algae.quote: 30 - 50% of oxygen is produced by algae
Kelp can grow up to a maximum of 200 feet
Algae can be composed of a single cell
Coral and Sea Anemones are symbiotic hosts to the algae zooxanthellae
The dinoflagellate Noctiluca is a bioluminescent algae
There are more algae in the oceans than stars in the universe
Algae are primary producers and the base of the marine food chain
Our brains are dependent on the iodine and omega-3 oils that algae contain
Agar is an algae-derived hydrocolloid
Algae is listed as carrageenan or alginate which can be found in the foods you eat and soaps you use
Algae have evolved protection from UV rays, and algae-based sunscreens hold promise
Algae can substitute for oil and natural gas in plastics
Climate change and fertiliser run-off has caused larger and lasting harmful algae blooms
Red algae living on the Greenland ice sheet account for 5 to 10 per cent of the ice sheetâ€™s shrinkage
Australian researchers recently discovered that a little Asparagopsis seaweed added to animal feed stops gut bacteria from producing gas
Algae have been estimated to include anything from 30,000 to more than 1 million species
Algae can be found in both freshwater and marine environments
Halimeda, is a genus of green macroalgae, that is abundant in coral reef environments and generates most of the calcium carbonate there
Crutose coralline algae are rock-hard calcareous red algae that contribute significantly to reef calcification and cementation
Algae are classified in the kingdom Protista
Algae are plant-like because they produce food through photosynthesis, but they lack structures such as roots, stems, or leaves
Some algae are motile and can move independently using pseudopods or flagella
Algae is the main component of phytoplankton
Kelp contains many important vitamins such as vitamins K, A, C, E, folate, B12, B6, thiamin, riboflavin, and pantothenic acid
Kelp also contain the minerals iodine, calcium, magnesium, iron, sodium, phosphorous, zinc, copper, manganese, and selenium
Marine phytoplankton are mainly composed of microalgae known as dinoflagellates and diatoms
Corals, anemones, and jellies are all related and classified in the phylum Cnidaria or "stinging needles"
Algae can produce sexually or asexually
Brown algae typically have root-like structures called "holdfasts" that are used to anchor the algae to a surface
The US Navy has run ships and planes on fuel made from the oils in algae
